title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.14.10 - 11 | 11-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya
Chaksharunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nityananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 10th verse of the 14th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
Pashyot Patan Naravyagra
Divyaan Bhauman Sadaihi Kaan
Darunan Shamsato Durat
Bhayamno Buddhi Mohanam
The meaning of this verse is spoken by Yudhishthira to Bhima
So he is addressing Bhima

three-fold miseries, miseries due to three different causes, which is always there in
material existence. Tapatraya, in Kannada they say tapatraya. What is this tapatraya?
Tapa means miseries, traya means three kinds. Three kinds of fundamental miseries are always
part of this material existence and they have been described here as divyaan, bhavmaan, daihikaan.
Divyaan is the celestial influences, supernatural powers over which you have no control, just
like rain. Too much rain or no rain.
Divyaan is misery for people on the earth.
They have suffered in so many ways. Or too much heat or too much cold. Or too much of
wind.

are to suffer the consequences
of our human duties. Does it mean we stop working? No. We have to do our duties but
we have to do it being in constant touch with Krishna through devotional service. And that
alone can ensure relief for us from all these miseries without our being disturbed in performing
our duties. Our mind and our body will not trouble us if we simply carry on with our
duties while simultaneously executing devotional service. Just like you chant Hare Krishna
and also do your duties, you will see the difference in your life. How you get relief
from so many unnecessary problems.
The Asuras, however, do not believe in the existence of God and they make their own plans
to counteract all these three-fold miseries. So they meet with failures every time. Krishna
says this in the Bhagavad Gita. Daivihesha gunamayi mamamaya duratyaya. The reaction
of material energy is never to be conquered because of the binding effects of the three
modes.
But one who surrenders to Krishna can overcome.

in the forest fire when they cannot escape such a fire cannot be extinguished by
human efforts
the fire can be extinguished only by the mercy of the Lord who sends clouds to
pour water on the forest when there's a torrential rain a big rain cloud pours
heavily down water on the forest the portion where there is fire spreading
then the fire can be extinguished otherwise there's no possibility of any
human intervention similarly undesirable happenings in life cannot be checked by
individuals
such miseries can be removed only by the mercy of the Lord who sends his
bona fide representatives to enlighten human beings and thus save them from all
calamities the Prabhupada has come he's come to save us from all these
calamities by Krishna consciousness that's the way to receive the mercy of
the Lord chanting Hare Krishna and doing it as directed by Prabhupada
